intro: Conospermum caeruleum var. marginatum, commonly known as the Blue Mistflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flower clusters that appear in spring. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a silvery underside, and it thrives in well-drained soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. The variety marginatum is distinguished by its white-edged flowers, adding a unique visual contrast to its overall appearance.
